bibl.title: Letter from John R. Taylor to Philip Showalter Hench, December 1, 1941

div1.p: Taylor thanks Hench for his letter. He is surprised to hear that Hench is studying the conquest of yellow fever. Taylor informs Hench that he took an active part in the experiments in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Taylor to Philip Showalter Hench, December 1, 1941
div1.opener:
548 Grand Ave
Upper Darby.
Pa
Dec 1, 1941
Dr Phillip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr Hench
div1.p:
I was agreeably surprised
to receive your letter of Nov 26, to know
that you had been making a study of the
conquest of yellow fever. Regret to state
that have not yet received the reprint of
your article that you promised to send
me. Usal Usually I have no trouble with
my mail, and should have got it by this time,
perhaps your secretary overlooked it.

May state that I have followed the history
of yellow fever for many years, and as my
friend Dr Fernandez may have told you, took
an active part in the experiments in Cuba.
Will appreciate a reprint of your article
